Key Match Events: Glenn Phillips scored 60 off 50 balls with 4 fours and 4 sixes.
South Africa scored 357/4 in their innings.
New Zealand were all out for 167 in 35.3 overs.
Pre-Game Insights: Both teams are in the top three at this stage, and the winners of this game will feel very secure about their future.
New Zealand endured back-to-back losses to India and Australia.
South Africa have been gung-ho, proving their only loss to Netherlands was an aberration.
South Africa's one-wicket win over Pakistan in Chennai saved them from a collapse.
The match promises an explosive cocktail of firepower with the bat and thrill with the ball.
Kagiso Rabada missed the previous game because of a niggle but is expected to return to the XI.
New Zealand have an injury list that's slowly growing, including Lockie Ferguson, Mark Chapman, Tim Southee, and Kane Williamson.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pune is unusually hot and dry for this time of the year, but the surfaces have been good for batting.
Conway has been dismissed twice in six games by left-arm spin at this World Cup.
Ravindra's tally of 406 runs is already the most by a New Zealander in his maiden World Cup.
South Africa's seven 300-plus totals in a row batting first in ODIs is the longest streak in the game.
South Africa's pace pack has taken 44 wickets at an average and a strike rate of 23.3 and 23.5, respectively.
